text: Mohammad Naim (born 22 August 1999) is a Bangladeshi cricketer. He made his international debut for the Bangladesh cricket team in November 2019. ==Domestic career== He made his List A debut for Legends of Rupganj in the 2017–18 Dhaka Premier Division Cricket League on 22 February 2018. Prior to his List A debut, he was part of Bangladesh's squad for the 2018 Under-19 Cricket World Cup. He made his first-class debut for Dhaka Metropolis in the 2018–19 National Cricket League on 15 October 2018. In October 2018, he was named in the squad for the Dhaka Dynamites team, following the draft for the 2018–19 Bangladesh Premier League. He made his Twenty20 debut for the Dhaka Dynamites in the 2018–19 Bangladesh Premier League on 12 January 2019. He was the leading run-scorer for Legends of Rupganj in the 2018–19 Dhaka Premier Division Cricket League tournament, with 807 runs in 16 matches. In August 2019, he was one of 35 cricketers named in a training camp ahead of Bangladesh's 2019–20 season. In November 2019, he was selected to play for the Rangpur Rangers in the 2019–20 Bangladesh Premier League. ==International career== In September 2019, he received his maiden call up for national team, when he was added to the squad for last two Twenty20 Internationals (T20Is) in the 2019–20 Bangladesh Tri-Nation Series, but he did not play in the series. In October 2019, he was named in Bangaldesh's T20I squad for their series against India. He made his T20I debut for Bangladesh, against India, on 3 November 2019. In November 2019, he was named in Bangladesh's squad for the 2019 ACC Emerging Teams Asia Cup in Bangladesh. Later the same month, he was named in Bangladesh's squad for the men's cricket tournament at the 2019 South Asian Games. The Bangladesh team won the gold medal, after they beat Sri Lanka by seven wickets in the final. In February 2020, he was named in Bangladesh's One Day International (ODI) squad for their series against Zimbabwe. He made his ODI debut for Bangladesh, against Zimbabwe, on 6 March 2020. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1999 births Category:Living people Category:Bangladeshi cricketers Category:Bangladesh One Day International cricketers Category:Bangladesh Twenty20 International cricketers Category:Dhaka Dynamites cricketers Category:Dhaka Metropolis cricketers Category:Legends of Rupganj cricketers Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:South Asian Games gold medalists for Bangladesh Category:South Asian Games medalists in cricket
title: Mohammad Naim
